\hypertarget{class_mx_array_ab4306c5e0791fd624b6038fd8fac3e58}{\index{\-Mx\-Array@{\-Mx\-Array}!\-Mx\-Array@{\-Mx\-Array}}
\index{\-Mx\-Array@{\-Mx\-Array}!MxArray@{\-Mx\-Array}}
\subsubsection[{\-Mx\-Array}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf \-Mx\-Array\-::\-Mx\-Array} (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{const cv\-::\-Mat \&}]{mat, }
\item[{mx\-Class\-I\-D}]{classid = {\ttfamily mx\-U\-N\-K\-N\-O\-W\-N\-\_\-\-C\-L\-A\-S\-S}, }
\item[{bool}]{transpose = {\ttfamily true}}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}explicit\mbox{]}}}}\label{class_mx_array_ab4306c5e0791fd624b6038fd8fac3e58}


\-Convert cv\-::\-Mat to \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{\-Parameters}
{\em mat} & cv\-::\-Mat object. \\
\hline
{\em classid} & classid of mx\-Array. e.\-g., mx\-D\-O\-U\-B\-L\-E\-\_\-\-C\-L\-A\-S\-S. \-When mx\-U\-N\-K\-N\-O\-W\-N\-\_\-\-C\-L\-A\-S\-S is specified, classid will be automatically determined from the type of cv\-::\-Mat. default\-: mx\-U\-N\-K\-N\-O\-W\-N\-\_\-\-C\-L\-A\-S\-S. \\
\hline
{\em transpose} & \-Optional transposition to the return value so that rows and columns of the 2\-D \-Mat are mapped to the 2nd and 1st dimensions in \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}, respectively. \-This does not apply the \-N-\/\-D array conversion. default true. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{\-Returns}
\hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} object.
\end{DoxyReturn}
\-Convert cv\-::\-Mat object to an \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}. \-When the cv\-::\-Mat object is 2\-D, the width, height, and channels are mapped to the first, second, and third dimensions of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} unless transpose flag is set to false. \-When the cv\-::\-Mat object is \-N-\/\-D, (dim 1, dim 2,...dim \-N, channels) are mapped to (dim 2, dim 1, ..., dim \-N, dim \-N+1), respectively.

\-Example\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
 cv::Mat x(120, 90, CV_8UC3, Scalar(0));
 mxArray* plhs[0] = MxArray(x);
\end{DoxyCode}
 

\-Definition at line 119 of file \-Mx\-Array.\-cpp.

\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily  \mbox{[}explicit\mbox{]}}}}\label{class_mx_array_a4f4dcca25beb643cf8e78a477513a522}

\subsubsection[{to\-Mat}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}cv\-::\-Mat {\bf \-Mx\-Array\-::to\-Mat} (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}

\item[{bool}]{transpose = {\ttfamily true}}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const}}\label{class_mx_array_a4c5bfc695872e880917a22d16fb8d6da}


\-Convert \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} to cv\-::\-Mat. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{\-Parameters}
{\em depth} & depth of cv\-::\-Mat. e.\-g., \-C\-V\-\_\-8\-U, \-C\-V\-\_\-32\-F. \-When \-C\-V\-\_\-\-U\-S\-E\-R\-T\-Y\-P\-E1 is specified, depth will be automatically determined from the classid of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}. default\-: \-C\-V\-\_\-\-U\-S\-E\-R\-T\-Y\-P\-E1. \\
\hline
{\em transpose} & \-Optional transposition to the return value so that rows and columns of the 2\-D \-Mat are mapped to the 2nd and 1st dimensions in \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}, respectively. \-This does not apply the \-N-\/\-D array conversion. default true. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{\-Returns}
cv\-::\-Mat object.
\end{DoxyReturn}
\-Convert a \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} object to a cv\-::\-Mat object. \-When the dimensionality of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is more than 2, the last dimension will be mapped to the channels of the cv\-::\-Mat. \-Also, if the resulting cv\-::\-Mat is 2\-D, the 1st and 2nd dimensions of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} are mapped to rows and columns of the cv\-::\-Mat unless transpose flag is false. \-That is, when \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is 3\-D, (dim 1, dim 2, dim 3) are mapped to (cols, rows, channels) of the cv\-::\-Mat by default, whereas if \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is more than 4\-D, (dim 1, dim 2, ..., dim \-N-\/1, dim \-N) are mapped to (dim 2, dim 1, ..., dim \-N-\/1, channels) of the cv\-::\-Mat, respectively.

\-Example\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
 cv::Mat x(MxArray(prhs[0]).toMat());
\end{DoxyCode}

{\em depth} & depth of cv\-::\-Mat. e.\-g., \-C\-V\-\_\-8\-U, \-C\-V\-\_\-32\-F. \-When \-C\-V\-\_\-\-U\-S\-E\-R\-T\-Y\-P\-E1 is specified, depth will be automatically determined from the the classid of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array}. default\-: \-C\-V\-\_\-\-U\-S\-E\-R\-T\-Y\-P\-E1. \\

\-Convert a \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} object to a single-\/channel cv\-::\-Mat object. \-If the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is 2\-D, the 1st and 2nd dimensions of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} are mapped to rows and columns of the cv\-::\-Mat unless transpose flag is false. \-If the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is more than 3\-D, the 1st and 2nd dimensions of the \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} are mapped to 2nd and 1st dimensions of the cv\-::\-Mat. \-That is, when \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is 2\-D, (dim 1, dim 2) are mapped to (cols, rows) of the cv\-::\-Mat by default, whereas if \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} is more than 3\-D, (dim 1, dim 2, dim 3, ..., dim \-N) are mapped to (dim 2, dim 1, dim 3, ..., dim \-N) of the cv\-::\-Mat, respectively.

\-Example\-: 
\begin{DoxyCode}
 cv::Mat x(MxArray(prhs[0]).toMatND());
\end{DoxyCode}

\-Convert \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} to std\-::vector$<$\-T$>$ by a specified conversion method. 


\begin{DoxyParams}{\-Parameters}
{\em f} & member function of \hyperlink{class_mx_array}{\-Mx\-Array} (e.\-g., \&\hyperlink{class_mx_array_a4c5bfc695872e880917a22d16fb8d6da}{\-Mx\-Array\-::to\-Mat}, \&\hyperlink{class_mx_array_a438400755505700235e1c71fa9a42354}{\-Mx\-Array\-::to\-Int}). \\

\-The method constructs std\-::vector$<$\-T$>$ by applying conversion method f to each cell array element. \-This is similar to std\-::transform function. \-An example usage is shown below\-:


\begin{DoxyCode}
